clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy of Two Liquid Oxygen Devices in Deambulation
clinical_study.official_title: Efficacy of Two Liquid Oxygen Devices in Deambulation

lead_sponsor.agency: Fundació Institut de Recerca de l'Hospital de la Santa Creu i Sant Pau

clinical_study.source: Fundació Institut de Recerca de l'Hospital de la Santa Creu i Sant Pau

brief_summary.textblock: Some oxygen conserving devices have been developed to diminish oxygen expense. These devices offer optimisation of oxygen therapy for deambulation by improving time autonomy of patients.

primary_outcome.measure: To determine the efficacy of correcting desaturation during effort and the acceptance of two different oxygen conserving devices during deambulation,one system with reservoir an another one with oxygen demand valve.

clinical_study.condition: To Determine the Efficacy of Two Liquid Oxygen Device

arm_group.description: Patients with chronic obstructive pulmonary disease who show arterial oxygen desaturation to effort.
Patients with interstitial lung disease who show arterial oxygen desaturation to effort

intervention.description: Three 6MWT test will be performed at random with conventional oxygen continuous-flow,by Oxymizer Pendant and demand valve system. The percentage of patients correcting their desaturation and patients' acceptance of every method will be determinated.

Three 6MWT test will be performed at random with conventional oxygen continuous-flow,by Oxymizer Pendant and demand valve system. The percentage of patients correcting their desaturation and patients' acceptance of every method will be determinated
intervention.other_name: Oxygen conserving devices in interstitial lung disease.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients with arterial oxygen desaturation to effort.
- COPD with TLC > 90%
- EPID with TLC < 90% and FEV1/FVC > 70%
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with long-term oxygen therapy (LTOT) in deambulation.
- Not clinically stable during last month.
- Smokers
